intro: Allophylus exappendiculatus, commonly known as the African wild pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature, containing a single seed. Allophylus exappendiculatus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
